attribute.name: medium-screen

attribute.description: Stores the state of the datatable on the client, so that after a page reload the same filters are active, the same page is shown etc.
attribute.name: save-state

attribute.description: Stores the state of the datatable on the client, so that after a page reload the same filters are active, the same page is shown etc.
attribute.name: saveState

attribute.description: If set, this will have the container match the height of the rows shown in the table if that height is smaller than that given height by the scroll-size. Default: true.
attribute.name: scroll-collapse

attribute.description: If set, this will have the container match the height of the rows shown in the table if that height is smaller than that given height by the scroll-size. Default: true.
attribute.name: scrollCollapse

attribute.description: Adds a horizontal scroll bar on small screens. Similar to scroll-x, but wraps the entire table within the scroll area. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: scroll-horizontally

attribute.description: Adds a horizontal scroll bar on small screens. Similar to scroll-x, but wraps the entire table within the scroll area. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: scrollHorizontally

attribute.description: If set, force the height of table to the size specified. You can optionally to add the unit (e.g. scroll-size="200px"). By default, it's px.
attribute.name: scroll-size

attribute.description: If set, force the height of table to the size specified. You can optionally to add the unit (e.g. scroll-size="200px"). By default, it's px.
attribute.name: scrollSize

attribute.description: If set, the table can scroll horizontally. Similar to scroll-x, but uses a different approach, so the page selector, the search are not scrolled with the table. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: scroll-x

attribute.description: If set, the table can scroll horizontally. Similar to scroll-x, but uses a different approach, so the page selector, the search are not scrolled with the table. Defaults to false.
attribute.name: scrollX

attribute.description: If set to false, this feature completely disables the search functionality of the datatable (i.e. both the UI and the JavaScript API).
attribute.name: searching

attribute.description: Allows the user to select rows. Defaults to false. Is automatically set to true if selected-column, selected-row or selection-mode is set.
attribute.name: select

attribute.description: Optional parameter defining which columns are selected when the datatable is initially rendered. If this attribute is an integer, it's the column index. If it's a string, it's a jQuery expression. Automatically sets selection='true' and selected-items='column'.
attribute.name: selected-column

attribute.description: Optional parameter defining which columns are selected when the datatable is initially rendered. If this attribute is an integer, it's the column index. If it's a string, it's a jQuery expression. Automatically sets selection='true' and selected-items='column'.
attribute.name: selectedColumn

attribute.description: Determines whether rows, columns or individual cells are selected. Legal values are 'row', 'column', and 'cell'. The default value is 'row'. Automatically sets select='true'.
attribute.name: selected-items

attribute.description: Determines whether rows, columns or individual cells are selected. Legal values are 'row', 'column', and 'cell'. The default value is 'row'. Automatically sets select='true'.
attribute.name: selectedItems

attribute.description: Optional parameter defining which rows are selected when the datatable is initially rendered. If this attribute is an integer, it's the row index. If it's a string, it's a jQuery expression. If it's another object, it's compared to the loop var. Automatically sets selection='true' and selected-items='row'.
attribute.name: selected-row

attribute.description: Optional parameter defining which rows are selected when the datatable is initially rendered. If this attribute is an integer, it's the row index. If it's a string, it's a jQuery expression. If it's another object, it's compared to the loop var. Automatically sets selection='true' and selected-items='row'.
attribute.name: selectedRow

attribute.description: The datatable shows below the table how many rows are selected. Setting this option to false deactivates this feature. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: selection-info

attribute.description: The datatable shows below the table how many rows are selected. Setting this option to false deactivates this feature. Defaults to true.
attribute.name: selectionInfo

attribute.description: Set this property to "single" if you want to prevent multiple selections. Default is "multiple".
attribute.name: selection-mode

attribute.description: Set this property to "single" if you want to prevent multiple selections. Default is "multiple".

By default, the algorithm checks the ids, which means the the 'for' component has to be a NamingContainer. Note that this algorithm fails if you use the prependId='false'. Alternatively, you can activate a slower but more flexible algorithm by setting 'recursive' to true.

attribute.description: Mode of the Slider Widget. There are three modes available : badge, edit and basic. In basic mode, only the slider and the label(if present) will be shown and the slider value will be hidden. In badge mode, the default, the slider value will be shown in a badge. In edit mode, an editable input field showing the slider value will be shown; in this mode you can change the value by sliding or editing the value in the field.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: Determines whether the slider handles move horizontally (min on left, max on right) or vertically (min on bottom, max on top). Possible values: "horizontal"(default), "vertical", "vertical-bottom". If vertical is specified, the Label is rendered on top, then the value and the slider on the bottom. If vertical-bottom is specified, the slider is rendered on top, then the value and the Label on the bottom.
attribute.name: orientation
